result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eleasar Barron Jr

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing.  Defendant failing to appear, COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.

Defendant Eleasar Barron in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  
Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Atty. Valdez is still waiting for some documents from his client but requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Eleasar Barron in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Atty. Valdez still cannot view discovery in 22CM298 and requests another status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Eleasar Barron in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Atty. Valdez has just received discovery in defendant's and requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Appointing Counsel at County Expense, signed and filed.  rmm
Absolute sobriety.  No driving without a valid license.  Court ordered defendant to be supervised by JusticePoint, Level 3.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR A PUBLIC DEFENDER.  
*
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Ramon Valdez as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Valdez accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 4/01/22 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Defendant Eleasar Barron in court.  Atty. Ramon Valdez appeared as a friend of the court.
Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

signed and filed.  rmm
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/1/22 @ 2p
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Eleasar Barron not in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/4/22 @ 1p
